review: The service is horrible here! They have one waitperson scrambling to help 30 people. Hire some help! I'm sorry every time I go here. Unfortunately Turlock only has 5 restaurants so Red Robin takes advantage by understaffing because they know people have no other options.

Ate at the Bar with Brady the bartender keeping my drinks full. The service was excellent and the bartenders were very friendly. The woman who's name started with an "A" was helping me out too. She was awesome! I had the Prime Chophouse burger and an ice cold beer since it was only $2.50 for happy hour. It was good. It hit the spot on a very long road trip. I'd stop by again when passing through and I recommend it to others.

Came here for a friend's birthday dinner which was probably not such a good idea on a Saturday night. The place was packed and service was pretty bad. We never got refills on our drinks or fries and when we finally waved our server down, she brought us the tab instead...and we had just gotten our food! However food-wise, the food was pretty decent. For appetizers we ordered the 3-for-all and then my friend and I shared the arctic cod burger which was pretty good. My other friends shared the whiskey river BBQ burger which looked pretty good too. I'd choose take out over dine in.

The service  was good cant remeber the lady's name but it was in the afternoon we order 3 bacon burgers and some macaroni and ribs everything was delicious, she had our drink ready very attentive no complaints they did a wonderful job and i will always return thanks!!

The Grilled Chicken Sandwich along with a handful of steak fries really does hit the spot. And the calorie count doesn't hurt my desire to lose weight and still have a good meal with friends. The waiter was really nice. Our food arrived very fast. Nice place to go when you want to just hangout at the bar too. TV's spread out through the establishment.

My Yelping has been on hiatus do to no thoughts. But here we were again heading north on yet another adventure. Ditto my previous other than it was an Thursday and quiet but sat at the bar anyway. Not being hungry had the Clamdiggerr's Chowder ( much better than any I had in New England last fall!) and the bride had roasted veggie soup. Both came with warm focaccia, delicious
I like our server Scott for closing at 8/15/12. He made us feel welcomed and was very attentive to us.  Very yummy meal. Try the buttercake.
This was the best experience I've had at Red Robin. We sat in the bar, perfect service! Thank you! Elk Grove location should take notes!

Came here and we got seated pretty quick it was a Friday night right before they closed, not many people at all more than half the restaurant was open yet when they seated us it took about 12 min for anyone to even acknowledge that we were there! The guy who served us was kind of slow at first but he sped up got us drinks without asking and came back frequently. It was a party of 4 with us and we all got appetizers which came rather fast and i got the Royal Red Robin Burger . Food was good but the service has got to SPEED UP!

I just went here for the first time because I really dnt eat fast food or at fast food type of spots but my friend insisted. The place was nice but I thought the food was overpriced for the quality, the burger was good but wasn't the best or the worst I've had. I prefer making my own when it comes to this type of food. I probably won't return but you might love this place.

Used to be a regular here also. Knew the wait staff, good food. Now it seems service has worsened as well as what you pay for. We don't go as much and have found local restaurants offering the quality we appreciate.

Whether you are looking for a burger, or a nice dinner, Red Robin delivers.  I am a FAN of their Burger's.  The best in town for my money.  If you sign up for their Royalty card you get a free burger for your birthday!
My To Go order was missing a meal as well as a dinner salad. We ordered four items at 9:00 pm - def not during a rush. Super annoying!
its a good burger joint kinda of pricey but if ur hungry its okay and there pretty quick
It's ok I feel like sometimes they are understaffed and they take so long to bring you your order food and drink is great but I would work on better staffing

Man this was the first time I ever got a raw party from any hamburger joint I mean seriously can't they see a bloody piece of meat is not edible. I hate that place bad because of one screw up oh well at least I didn't eat it.

I have recently become obsessed with this place. The service is mediocre, but the food has never let me down. My favorite thing to eat there is their clam chowder soup. I've tried others, and hands down, theirs is the best. Burgers and appetizers are good too.

Prime beef in a burger? Only had that at a Fudrucker's before last week. I found Red Robin's a bit on the dry side, but really tasty. The assistant manager checked in on our table, and that impressed me. Bottomless fries, ghost pepper ketchup, a really good seasoned salt, and great service. A bit pricey, but worth the expense for the experience.  Clean? Yes. Service? Good. Food quality? Good. Overall? I'll go back for another special burger.

Had dinner here last night and it was really good. The place was crowded so it did take a while for the food to come. The chicken sandwich was great. I am really picky about my chicken being cooked long enough and it turned out perfectly. I will be returning soon
Good quality burgers & great customer service. Dined here on NYE with my boyfriend when it was pretty busy but still received good service and didn't feel rushed. Will be returning!

I have to agree they have great quality burgers! Their fries are blah though and I've actually gotten really cold and hard fries with my burger but I didn't care because the guac bacon burger was just so flavorful and delicious!

Considering it's not exactly fine dining, the food is actually pretty good, and the prices are really reasonable. The place is definitely understaffed, and it takes a while until your food arrives. This is definitely not the staff's fault, they all serve you with courtesy and a smile, no matter how stressed they are, but employing two or three more waiters during rush hour sure wouldn't hurt. The worst part though is that it's insanely noisy, it's hard work to have a conversation there. Plus, the flat screen TVs hanging in every corner are really distracting, usually showing some sports. Last time I was there, though, they had some reality show running on them with a whole number really violent clips, during family dinner hour, no less.

I was just here this place sucks, don't get me wrong the girl whom sat us was really nice... We were sitting there at least 20 mins no one come by & help us didn't even ask us what we want to drink or anything Really bad service... When we got up & left no ones stop us & ask if there's anything wrong....

Wow! This place is awesome! They have all kinds of burgers. I tried their red robin burger, tavern burger and chicken pesto sandwich before!! I also love their fries!!! Husband and the kids loved it here!! Nice atmosphere as well :)
Red robbin's fries are so delicious! So is their ranch. I love this place. It is my go to when I want to have dinner with a friend or relative. It's worth a try!

Just ate here and had an unpleasant experience. The drink I ordered, I ordered without ice due to my teeth being sensitive, needless to say my drink glass went from a tall glass to a short shot glass with practically two sips in it when you took out the fruit. I complained and they added more juice and syrup and the shot glass seemed bigger. My fiancé asked for no mayo on his burger, it came with mayo, he asked for salt on his margarita and got sugar. Lastly we asked for separate checks, my fiancés drink was on his mothers bill.  Not sure if it was just the totality of everything, but the food was so so. Granted, it's not a fine dining restaurant, so I accept getting what I paid for....except the drink.

YUMMM!  You can't go wrong with Red Robin. They are consistently tasty with great service and atmosphere. Went here on a quick lunch date with my parents as we drove through town. The  wait was only about 5 minutes even though you could tell they were packed.  The last time I had eaten at a Red Robin, I ordered one of their Finest Gourmet Burgers, the Smoke and Pepper burger with peppery bacon, sharp cheddar, special sauce and a ciabatta bun. I was so please with it before that I decided to order it again! I even convinced my dad to order one, and he has some pretty good burger taste. He loved it, and so did I (again)! I think I will be ordering one of the gourmet burgers every trip now because they are just so delicious and cure my craving for a juicy dose of red meat and fries :D The one downside during this trip is they had a very large birthday party seated near us when we came in, who left about 10 minutes later. The 4-5 tables for that group were left messy and unattended for the duration of our meal and it was just not very nice to see it all sitting there for so long without at least an attempt to clean it up. But other than being unsightly it didn't affect my meal.  Nice location for the restaurant. Lots of parking, great for families, and quick service.

We commute along Hwy 99 and this Red Robin is located easy off freeway.  As a chain the menu is very predictable.  The past 2 times we stopped at this location we were disappointed in the food quality. Fries were cold and soggy, even when we asked for fresh ones.  Some of the staff were to loud in their socializing and eating/snacking too much while waiting to pick up orders.  I know we will be back to a Red Robin, but this one may be a last resort.

Food quality has decline since last visit.  Wifes patty was burnt on edges and we hard a difficult time finding the blue cheese on a blue cheese burger. On one the burgers the server didn't even know which burger it was! Service was slow and bad when we did get it.

Always love going here. The food is amazing and always excelently prepared. The food usually takes not much time and always gives much satisfaction. It is one of my most favorite places in town to go and eat and also very relaxing.
Burgers are always good this location is usually very busy expect a wait on evenings and weekends they even have some outdoor seating and are really close to the freeway.

Usually a chain restaurant like RR has serving standards, I like the food here, but I've never had great service. Today, we were sat, and didn't see a server for well over 5 minutes. Finally a server came over and told us our real server was getting drinks, gave us a female name.  Then, it took over 5 min to receive the drinks. The food came and was good, but we still hadn't been greeted by a server, just random people walking by asking us if we needed anything. One of those people brought us a bill later. The managers were there, but it seemed like they were too busy picking up the slack to address any problems.

I can't believe the good ratings on this place. Other than our server, Kristen, I saw nothing to like. My wife had fish and chips which were stacked in a small burger basket. If was impossible add salt or malt vinegar to one without getting the other. We had to order an extra plate. Speaking of salt...Seriously? A salt grinder in a burger joint. The fries seemed like they had been in a heating drawer since morning. Soggy and tough skinned. Tip to management... you improve the experience with food and service not spice grinders. Maybe they think that salt and pepper grinders justify their outrageous prices. We can go across the street for a gourmet Japanese lunch for the this kind of money. When did $32 become a good diner value?

Just had the best worst experience at one of my fav restaurants. A "lost" order turned long wait, missed food items that turned out to be wrong burger for me, all the while sharing that we were sort of celebrating boys upcoming bday in a week cause I got one of those offer emails. As the manager gradually discovered this story playing out, the look on her face was precious. Just had to giggle. Normally, our Red Robin service is impeccable,  this was waaaaay out of character. When I got the bill, much of our items had been comped and/or discounted, $20 for about $80 worth of food. Multitude of apologies from manager and waiter. Now THAT is EXCELLENT customer service.

If this review was based on customer service, I would give them 5 stars.  My husband and I have never had a bad experience at this Red Robin. Unfortunately, if this review was based on price, it would be 2-3 stars. Prices have steadily increased within the past few years. Mostly by charging for extras, like sweet potato fries and gluten free bread.  I love the variety of burgers and salads, but feel for the price I could go to a nicer restaurant and get a better quality burger for just a dollar or 2 more....where they don't charge me $1.50 for sweet potato fries. I love the recent makeover and think it gives this Red Robin a cleaner look. Plus, the fact that they call the bar their "adult section," aka no kids, makes me happy! Good food, great customer service, bad prices.

Server and other workers were great. There were two large parties next to us and our server was awesome always attentive and apologetic when not even needed. She was great. Blonde tall and thin. Didn't get her name /: &  Fries and lemonade always good. My daughters pizza was doughy /: and the ghost pepper burger was okay, although packed with about 15 Thick slices of jalapeño. I'm a spicy hot food lover! Trust me. This was way over the edge . Just a warning. (:

WORST SERVICE EVER! First off, I never send food back. Today my food was undercooked, so I told the waitress and she  took the whole plate back, then only brought back 1/3 of the food back, still undercooked and missing my sides... Had to bring her back to get the rest of my food, told our waitress the part she actually brought was undercooked still and she didn't even try to fix it or apologize, just said the manager would take it off the bill. Left hungry and pissed off, HORRIBLE WAITRESS, HORRIBLE FOOD.

I have been to this restaurant five times since it first opened, and each time was a bad experience. I hoped it would change, but it never did. Everything from staff ignoring you for 10mins when you walk in and stand at the podium waiting to be seated (and the place isn't even crowded) to being seated and "forgotten" for over half an hour to getting your meal served cold and unable to get the waiter to come back. On one occasion, I spoke with a manager and politely complained about the severe lack of service at this restaurant, and he apologized and offered me half off on the bill. After the fifth bad visit, I realized nothing was going to change, so I stopped eating here. I haven't been to this location in at least three years now....and I don't plan on going back.

I really enjoy Red Robin, it's hard not to. I've never ever left hungry due to their bottomless steak fries and gargantuan burgers.  It's not that I usually receive bad service, the Turlock branch usually does very well, but last night was the best service I've had at Red Robin, anywhere. Our server John was always accessible without hovering and whenever we needed campfire sauce or more fries they were brought to the table within a minute. I've never had service so fast. If any manager is checking Yelp, and they'd be foolish not to, they need to make sure they hold on to that man. The burger selection is huge, and I appreciate they offer most in a chicken version. But they are a bit pricey. And I don't know if it's me, but the patties are so thick that most burgers taste the same. I appreciate a smaller burger so I can actually taste what else is on there. My burger was so thick and had so many onion straws that I could hardly taste the Bleu cheese. Great job with the redesign, somehow it all looks bigger, and I especially like the partition separating the dining section from the waiting area. The giant chalkboard is a genius touch, instead of kids crawling around the arcade games that used to be up I saw a father playing tic tac toe with his little daughter.

Great food. I always love their burgers and the steak fries! Oh the fry spices are the best part.  They are always packed on weekends, but they are never rude-always courteous with smiles.  We usually get food packed to go and for under $20- two gourmet burgers and like 5 lbs of fries. Yum!

They can be a hit or miss place. The burgers are usually good but the last one I had could have been better quality. I got salad instead of fries and it didn't smell right so I didn't eat it. I do like the hot wings. They had the right amount of heat and had a nice crunch. Most of the servers are nice but some can be cruel. I remember sliding off of one of their banquettes because it wasn't properly secured. A couple of the employees laughed and not one employee came to make sure I was okay. I was angry about it and let the manager know that. He apologized for what happened. Most of the time when I'm here I go to chili's or angelini's. The food , service, and prices are better than what you get here.

I don't know why I bother. Family and friends keep having lunches here so we join them. The service is awful. Every time. Half of our party was finished eating when the other half of the food came. I told the server to box mine up. No apologies. She's just like sure! 45 min for a burger. Thanks but no thanks.

This place has gotten WAY better! The remodel looks great and the new food variety is amazing! I recommend the Beam shake, Southern Charm burger, and bottomless garlic fries! You can't beat bottomless options, all the side varieties for kids, options for dieters/allergy sensitive people. The hostess was a sweetheart and our server Kaitlin was on top of everything and kept a big smile. The restaurant was busy but everyone was doing their best and the managers were chipping in to keep the flow going. I don't get why there are so many bad reviews on here.

Wait time was average 20 minutes. Was seated. 45 minutes before we got our food. When we got it finally it was COLD!!! This is the second time with this Red Robin. The waitress was great she was responsible for way too many tables, however. Clearly not staffed for a busy Saturday at 2pm. Probably wont be back. ****Business owner contacted me, very impressed for reading the review and contacting me******for this I gave an extra star for customer service ****

I'll start off by saying that I frequently visit this location. I attend CSU Stanislaus, and this place is right next to campus. In the past, this place never let me down. If I was in the mood for a good burger, this place had an amazing selection with great tasting burgers. To top it all off, they offer bottomless fries.  As of recent, red robin has completely failed to deliver the amazing food I have grown accustomed to. The last 4 visits I have always received cold food, or incorrect food. Today was no different. This time I requested to speak with the manager to explain to her my current experience,  and past experiences. The thing that pushed me to write a bad review was the managers response. She simply replied with "Im sorry about that..." She went on to be rude to one of my guests. I would expect a manager to try to make my experience better, but that was not the case. This is not how a manager should be talking to guests.

I don't know what happen you usually when I come here everything is good but yesterday my visit was horrible. Waitress took forever to take our order. And when we got our drinks I had to ask three different waitresses to bring as sweet and low they keep forgetting about us. I try that gourmet hamburger and the meat was bland. So please do not pay $15 like I did for this burger that had no flavor. Usually this place has great burgers I don't know what happen yesterday the restaurant look different and maybe there's changes. Even the fries taste different. (not good)

I believe I've left a review on this already when the customer service was impeccable and the food delectable. My colleagues and I used to go to red robin so often and stopped for a few months. Just recently I've gone twice and each time was so bad. We usually don't complain but it was difficult not to! The fries were cold AND disgusting...The new version of garlic fries is a cheap version of the previous with garlic POWDER instead of actual garlic. They got my co-worker's order wrong twice and I had to ask for sauce 3 times before I got it. On top of that we were sitting in the bar area (as we usually do) and they normally play music which isn't a big deal. However, this time they were playing this really obnoxious wannabe rock type of music. That isn't the bad part, I can sit through bad music, the fact that I was watching this woman lying naked with Hershey kisses all over her body was what was disturbing to me. The channel they were using for the music was absolutely inappropriate for any restaurant. I think the bartender heard complaints so he turned of the music BUT he still kept the music videos up. Then we asked the waitress for a cake of some sort because we always go to red robin for birthdays or departing co-workers (our coworker was leaving us) and she said oh I don't know I have to ask...UMM HELLO WE DIDNT ASK FOR FREE CAKE NOW GIVE ME A DAMN CAKE. Just the entire experience was ridiculous. She was a horrible waitress and the food was not up to par. New look new staff?
I love this place I come when I can. Affordable and fast. Friendly staff and great Burgers always a good experience when I come here.

This place is awesome, specially for a group or for  a birthday celebration, it gets loud though! We were there for dinner on a Saturday night, there was a large group kids and their parents, the kids were everywhere, we were pretty annoyed, since it was loud and we couldn't hear eachother! They have awesome burgers! Although since I have stopped eating meat, it's harder for me to choose what to eat, only options are fries, mac and cheese, or the fish and chips! I've tried the fish and chips it not the best! I love the fact that the fries are bottomless the sweet potato fries are my best! Also the variety of sauces they offer is nice! Overall this the place to go if you want delicious burgers and bottomless fries!

15 min wait: Just got asked how many in my party. The greeting was not friendly and I waited too long not even being acknowledged as staff walked right by. 30 mins later: Well so far our server has been friendly but the food is so slow. Still waiting for our food to come out. Drink service is also slow too.(10 mins for drinks.) Finally got our food. (Another 45 mins) The hamburger buns were soggy.  The garlic fries didn't taste like garlic. I didnt finish my meal. Disappointing visit.

This location was awful. The service was very slow. They sat us at a table without even saying their name or who our server will be. It took forever to get our drinks ordered and even longer to get the drinks. The food was cold, I would of ask for a new plate but our waitress was never around. The place wasn't even busy when I went in. I was very disappointed I couldn't enjoy my food.

We ended up here rather unexpectedly, and I was cautious after a bad trip to another RR further north.  Bottom line on the food is that it was good, but we would not drive the thirty miles just for the food. Chili burger, guac burger and the Black and Bleu. I would not pay $14 for that Black and Bleu again either. It's a good burger, just not worth $14, AND it's just a burger! The bartender needs to learn Glenlivet and water does not mean Glenlivet and soda. And the noise? Oh my Lordie, that was loud. The food was slow, we were there two hours but we came at rush hour. Ok, so now we get to the good part. The ladies. Incredible job amongst the noise and chaos.  We wanted to take Mary Anne and Natalie home but their shifts weren't over. Thank you, ladies, for a VERY fun evening. Landon says thank you for the car race, his carrots and balloon, too.

Although the food is very good and my server was attentive, I had a recent issue at this restaurant. Below is the form letter I sent to the restaurant. In response, they sent me an email suggesting I check my rewards before before dining. There was no mention of the issue I had nor the server telling me the wrong information and charging me for something she said was free. This is NOT good customer service and I will NOT go to this Turlock restaurant again. In my opinion, don't bother filling out a survey or contacting customer service if you have an issue because they don't care.  "Hello, I visited the Turlock Red Robin today. My waitress, Kristin, saw that I had a Red Card and told me that I qualify for a free shake. I normally don't order shakes but since my server said it was free if I spent $10, I ordered one to split with my friend. As the server dropped off my bill, she informed me that one of my sandwiches would be free since I was about to reach my 10th item. After leaving the restaurant, I examined my bill and noticed that I was charged for the free shake my server said I qualify for. One of my sandwiches was free, like Kristin stated, but I was charged $3.99 for my shake. I would not have ordered a shake if it was not free. I am not happy about ordering a "free" shake and then being charged for it. If it was not free, then my server should not have told me it was. I feel like my server used a "bait and switch" technique to get me to order something I would not have ordered if I had to pay for it."

I love this place. Not only do they have great food but the customer service is so refreshing compared to other places I have gone to. I recommend this place to anyone with a family who wants to enjoy a great meal. They also have the bottomless fries which I love.
We sat in the bar and had great service! Didn't have to wait to be seated at all. My husband had his burger and I had the sea food platter. The food tasted great no complaints here.

Worst service ever.  Wife's lemonade glass was chipped. Waitress took order but never checked on us again.  No napkins or silverware given. So skimpy on fries, counted 13 fries given with my burger.  No one got a drink refilled.  Very unsatisfied.

"0" stars but unfortunately it won't let me. This is the second time and we have waited over an hour to be seated cause the seater/greater can't read names and can't do basic math and very rude to customers, very rude.

Food and service is usually good. But based on my last experience 1 star for the friendly girl who sat us where we wanted and 1 for good food. But our waitress was horrible. She would walk away quickly before we could ask for anything. She brought our drinks but food took a long time and I never got my refill of fries bc she took too long! She seemed to be friendly and take her time outside with a big party of guys though. And we had to leave to make it to the movie we wanted to see. I was disappointed!

The food is absolutely fantastic,  always made fresh with an ambundant amount of servings.  WHY not 5? The "WAIT- TIME"  is always wrong.  Most restaurants overshoot it or estimate it accurately.  But this particular Red Robin undershoots their time pretty off.   They make people starve for too long.  Almost 9 out of 10 times,  it'll be like: "20 minute wait"  = 45 minutes later" or they give us "1hr wait"  = "2hr and half" is what happens.  Luckily everytime I come here with friends,  we always expect the worse time provided by doing something else or have an extra time contingency for other plans after dinner.

If I could put 0 stars I would this place sucked !!!!! Horrible sevice burger was cold ordered jalepeno burger and when It came , she said sorry there's no jalepenos, took 30 mins to get check by far worse sevice EVRR !! I recommend going to the riverbank location don't go here !!!!!

Best burger joint ever!! Me and my GF loves this place. One of the best values in town, a burger plus bottomless fries for under ten bucks!! Great service, plus newly redesigned. I consider this my favorite spot to eat in Turlock hands down.

Started off well, as most trips to Red Robin often do. Have learned in the past to order the bottomless fries refill as soon as the server brings your food so I'm not sitting with no burger left waiting for fries....yet still this was the case. Please do not advertise bottomless fries if you cannot supply a steady stream of them. Burgers were good as usual, but damn...keep up with the fries.
Great service! Alana was a great waitress! Very attentive! Great food! Best gluten free burgers!
Amazing people!! We feet so welcome. Maryann helped us and really paid a lot of attention to my son. My son got a ballon after he ate dinner!

My wife and I went there on a Saturday afternoon knowing it would be busy. We checked in at the front desk... While sitting and waiting we noticed several families seated before two of us,  so I went to ask why this was? The girl stated I called your name already, I was never more than 7 feet from her..I politely stated she hadn't well after quizzing her she was pronouncing my wife's two syllable name incorrectly,so after correcting that she seated us(maybe suggest this young lady pays more attention to names) anyways we understood it was busy mind you, we were told a server would take our drink order shortly .. After some time a young lady stopped at our table and asked if we had been helped we told her no we had not. She said she would be glad to do so. I'm a Newcastle beer drinker and didn't see it on the menu .. I asked she said they had recently discontinued it but would see if any were still about she found some and swiftly brought us our drink order . I was very happy and the zombie she got my wife was excellent as well. In closing our food was fresh and very good, we got off to a rocky start but thanks to (Mary Ann) it turned out very well.
Food is ok, same as any other Red Robin. The service is what's lacking. We literally asked 2 servers for more fries and a side of ranch dressing and it finally showed up when we were done eating...

You get what you pay for, and that's about right for Red Robin. If you just want some run-of-the-mill burger that you could make for yourself at home if you weren't so lazy, then this is for you. But honestly, unless you want something fancy, In-N-Out's the place to go. Anyway, the food's not bad, but nothing to rave about either. The main sticking point for me was the wait time - it was about 45 minutes for two, and the hostesses seemed very flustered and disorganized the entire time. I can't imagine why the particular weekend I was there was any different than any other, so it seems like maybe they need more managerial oversight.

Service was on point. We sat in the bar area and started the evening with Bloody Mary's. Asked for extra olives and they were very generous. I ordered a chicken burger with sweet potatoe fries and my date ordered the burger with eggs and regular fries everything was great. It had been a long time since we visited, but after stopping by today we will definitely be back soon. By the way I'm not sure when they remodeled the restaurant, but it's definitely very hip and the menu selection is wide.

Tried this place again not by choice I was meeting some of the moms from my sons baseball team, they chose the place. Same problems nothing changed rude waitress, dirty utensils, and the food tasted like it's been in a freezer for a year. That royalty business is annoying! Our waitress basically begged us to join so she wouldn't get fired. If I want the damn card I'll do it! If I say no thank you I mean it! Never ever ever again will I be back & I left with a giant stomach ache. Also you folks need to enforce some sort of no phone on the floor policy because our waitress & a few others were visibly on their cell! Think about all those germs an then getting your drink made. YUCKKKKKKKKKKKKK!

This Red Robin is the worst! It is the worst for service. The management is awful. When we visit there is always a wait and strangely enough you are made to wait up to 45 min. when there are ALWAYS lots of tables available! Told today that the wait would be 30 min. for the 3 of us. I peeked into the dining room and saw at least 30 tables empty. There were another dozen that had not been bused . . . and this is on a weekend! The food is fine, but deep frustrations about the wait. Also once you get in, we have waited up to another 20 min. just to get drinks ordered. Hey manager, hire some more servers for goodness sake!
Service was nice. Food seemed off by the picture but was pretty good! I would go back!

Don't call ahead to order or attempt to place a to go order via phone.  They've set the phone system to answer and transfer your call every few seconds.  The first try was a little over five minutes with no live body.  The second try was a little over a minute and a half at around 8:30 pm on Wed, 5/20.  If I didn't have a gift card to use up, I'd never come back.  No customer service anymore.  Give up.  Go elsewhere. Good food but Bad service!! Restrooms are also filthy..thumbs down for this location. Ill always love thier burgers and shakes but sadly The Turlock location was just a hot mess when I was there. Was seated right away. waited 20 min. to order drinks not served. Walked out and waitress avoided eye contact as we walked by. Went to riverbank location which was a much better experience and worth the drive.

I have used call ahead seating on 2 separate occasions and both times I've been "greeted"  by the same unhappy/angry person. You'd think we'd learn. This Red Robin has sub par service always. Food is okay. New twist bottomless fries now come with strings. We ALWAYS got an order before the burger now they charge. Leaving one star is being generous. We have been coming to this restaurant since it had opened. While the restaurant has always been busy, we have always received reasonable service. Tonight we arrived and I noticed the parking lot is half full. When we walk into the front of the restaurant the waiting area is completely full. The waitress comes and takes our drink orders and our appetizer order. Drinks and the appetizer come in a reasonable amount of time. It takes an additional 20 minutes to get our check squared away. While we still enjoy Red Robin, we won't be back to this particular location. They have a long way to go to improve customer service.

Please please save yourself the time and dissapointment. Very disatisfied! And for the record I read yelp anytime I'm out of town and am looking for a place to eat. I have mix feelings about this place. And I'm not talking about the food, I'm talking about how to tip at this establishment. First let me explain to yelp users my experience. Red robins looks like Red robins, red, ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ . The hosts were ok. They put yours formation down on the tablet and call your name when the tables ready. There's no pager or text or anything like that just a shout.  When we were sat, our server took our drink order when she arrived to the table and tells us if we want to order appetizers go ahead and order on the tablet at your table. So we did. She returned and took our main meal orders. On this tablet there are games you can play, like trivia, plants vs. zombies, just the apple/android games you can download on your tablet/phone. You can also check your bill and order dessert on the table.  I ordered the whiskey river BBQ chicken sandwich with sautéed mushrooms and fried jalapeño. Keep in mind it's $1.49 added to your tab.  The fried jalapeño, eh I should have gotten fresh jalapeño. The chicken sandwich was ok, i couldn't really taste the BBQ. The side of garlic aioli dressing I got was very good and garlicky.  Overall the food was ok.3 stars. But the issue with the tip was. I take my own appetizer order and/or dessert. She takes our main meal order. Brings drinks refills and someone else drops off the food (xpo) she brought our dipping sauces, napkins. And we check our own bill and pay with card at table, of we pay for cash, we hit the server button and she's on her way to pick up the cash. What else does she do? Basically I'm tipping out the bussers, food runners, and the little things our servers do. It does save a lot of time for our server to take on more tables but if they do the whole, each server keeps their own tip from their table that's crazy, they don't do much. It was a team effort ¯\_(ツ)_/¯  it was cool though.

Average. No one checks drinks or clears dishes or sees if someone's finishing and needs the check on their own--noooooo, they wait to be buzzed and walk blindly by.  With that off my chest, the BOCA veggie burger was cold; it had obviously been frozen and reheated, but not enough. Would it be so hard to wipe off the grill and throw it on there? I liked the thick lettuce "bun," the onion slices were thin and crunchy, and the burger oozed ketchup; the whole thing would've been better as a salad.  I still love their bottomless fries, and they made them well-done like I asked, in a special gluten-free batch. That's what gets the star--that, and convenience of location.

I've dined at Red Robin twice now and have been underwhelmed both times. In their defense, I don't eat burgers often, so I chose other menu options. And clearly, burgers are their forte -- not those other menu items. Although nothing was terrible, my food, the service and the overall environment of the restaurant is just unremarkable.

Today I went to Red Robin for lunch.  I was in the mood for something besides a burger or a chicken burger.  I didn't want to graze on a salad, so that narrowed down my choices tremendously.  The one laminated page had some specials that were awfully pricey. I narrowed it down to a wrap, or the Crispy Arctic Cod Sandwich.  I opted for the sandwich.  For some reason it seems that the kitchen is always understaffed at the beginning of the lunch rush.  It took a really long time for our food to arrive, but the restaurant wasn't very full when we got our orders in.  From where I sat, I couldn't tell how many cooks were in the kitchen. My sandwich was excellent.  The cod wasn't overly breaded, and the fish didn't taste greasy either.  In fact it was so good I didn't notice the pickles in my sandwich.  I think it was because there were bits of pickles already in the tartar sauce.  I don't like pickles and normally take them out before I start eating.  I didn't notice this time, until a pickle fell out of my sandwich after I took a big bite. The only disappointing aspect of my meal was the fries.  The initial helping of bottomless fries was neither not nor fresh, and they were not crispy either.  They were rather mushy.  So I just put in an order for more fries the second after I bit into the first fry.  The second basket was hot and fresh, so I didn't touch my first helping of fries until I was done with the fresh ones. I really like how easy it is to split checks with the wireless tablets at the tables.  Just select your meal, swipe your credit card, add the tip, sign, and away you go!  I am sure the restrooms were cleaned before I entered, because there was strong smell of bleach in the air when I was washing my hands.  Service was not terrible and not great, just good.

Oh, and in lieu of onions on the burger, instead it comes with 'onion strings', or some such. Basically, corn or wheat flour with some onion inside of it, again straight out of a can.$14.50 before tax &tip got me one of the most cheaply-produced and sensorily-disappointing meals I've ever had.

I haven't been here in a long time, and I recently went a few weeks ago. I must admit, I was a bit let down, but the food wasn't bad. I ordered the chicken sandwich, which was okay, four stars. It came with fries, but they were very skimpy, just a handful of them. Something had a funny taste, maybe the sauce. Overall, it wasn't bad, it was good. Just not 5 stars perfect.

You can get a decent burger and bottomless fries here.  They also have a decently stocked bar, and an outdoor seating area.  One thing I do not like here is that the place is extremely noisy, at times it feels like you have to yell to be heard by people sitting with you. The prices here are a little high for a hamburger.

We always have fun here.  Great burgers, love the bottomless fries (even bring some home for the dogs and parrots)  I like to go there to watch the games and have a few drinks.  The bar staff is always fun, they get our orders right every time.

I don't really leave reviews. But I think this should be out there. This has happened to us in more than one occasion at this location.  We have gone to other Red Robins & never have to wait as long as we do here. We checked in to eat @12:50pm.  Didn't get out food till 2pm. Not only did it take them 20 min to seat us.   There was plenty of open booths & tables. I think they need to hire more help. Instead of having the customer wait so long. We have always been a party of 3. I would understand if we had a big group. This just makes me not want to return here.

Awful experience. Went for lunch with coworkers before we had a 12 hour shift, waited over 2 hours for food and 30 minutes just to be sat. Finally our food came out and it was cold and overcooked. The egg on my royal burger was completely cooked through hard and the entire meal was cold including fries. By the time the manager came most just sent our food back and left hungry we didn't have time to wait for them to remake everything.

Really disappointed with our service today. Ordered our appetizer on the digital display at our table and didn't get it until 30 minutes later. Literally 30 minutes! We clicked the "call your server" button twice trying to get our servers attention so we could order drinks and nothing. When the appetizer finally came they brought out our food also. I saw the manager and as she was apologizing to the table next to us for the long wait I let her know we were really disappointed with the service and having ordered the appetizer so far ahead of our food there was no reason for them to come out at the same exact time. She apologized and removed the appetizer from our bill but said she was going to check the time we place the order and compare it (whatever that means) anyway she never came back. We both did not eat our meals and had to take them to go. If we ever do go back it will be during when they are not busy because it was very apparent today they are short-staffed and not prepared for busy days like the last day of school.

Came with a group of four. Got seated within 15 minutes. I could appreciate the service here because I had a better experience here than other locations I've been too. Our waitress was fast and efficient. Our food came out fast and was happy about it. I usually stick with the regular steak fries, but tried the garlic ones, and were very tasty. I'll come back to this location if ever I'm back in turlock.

Omg where do I start!! Honesty the best customer service ever!!! Not only were the employees great but AMAZING!!! They were so kind and generous today we went for lunch to celebrate the blessing of our first BABY BOY NEPHEW & GRANDSON!! They brought out an amazing sign congratulating my sister and also brought her out an ice cream to congratulate her!! Now to some it would be the free ice cream on your birthday which is normal we are grateful but to go out of their way and treat her was thee most kindness ever!!!!  Monique our waitress & Norma General Manager THANK YOU!

We love coming here for lunch to spend family time together, and of course the bottomless steak fries too. When we came in at noon, it was hardly filled with people which is very surprising. We were created by the manager and she was super friendly during our entire visit, made sure everything was great and that we were satisfied with everything. The first waitress we had, Monique, spent her time only with the big party and didn't bother coming to see us, so we had a second waitress, Ashley, come over and take our order. (Now we had waited almost 10 minutes to just get our drinks ordered from Monique.) After awhile Ashley had to leave, so the third waitress we had was very helpful and super friendly with us (which was very nice since the other two didn't really check on us that often.) The food was very good once again. We'll definitely be coming back again!

The only reason I'm giving even two stars is because when I FINALLY got my burger, it was good. So as a party of 8, my coworkers and I called ahead for a table, as were just on a lunch break and wanted to save a little time. We were seated quickly and our order was taken quickly enough. When the food came, however, my burger, which I asked for with no ketchup, had ketchup on it. I told the waiter I would just eat it anyway, as we were on a time limit. He said "Let me just go get you a new bun." One of my coworkers had ordered a chicken salad and it wasn't brought at all. He said he would bring that out within a couple minutes as well. Everyone else in in the party literally finished eating before either of us actually got our meals, which by then we had requested come in to-go boxes. We waited. And waited. We actually got our bills before we got our meals! As we got our meals, we gave the waiter our credit cards. I sat there and ate my entire burger and fries before the waiter was back with our cards and receipts. In fact, we had to get up and go to their register on our way out to get our cards back because he still hadn't returned! One of my coworkers suggested to the waiter that the two of us who had to wait so long for our food should be offered some sort of acknowledgment for our bad experience, and he just kind of laughed. It was abysmal service and I made sure he knew that with my lack of tip and note I left on the receipt! Will NOT be back!
They wouldn't accept my temporary DL.  It's government issued, so there is no excuse for this. We left and chose a local pub. Fuck corporate anything, weasles.

This Red Robin has always been  great but  today it was exceptional, mostly  because Melissa  was hands down the best server I've  ever had this whole year, most certainly at any Red Robins.  She was extremely kind and very  very  efficient. I didn't have to ask for anything which is rare, she had everything  covered before i could  ask! Will definitely  return !! Food was well cooked and perfectly  hot! It tasted better  than other red robins as well.

Love the food here. It used to be better though. For example they used to have this amazing thousand island sauce and then it got changed. And the portions of fries that Come with the food have gotten smaller! Regardless you can get unlimited fries so that doesn't really matter anyway. Food is still really good.

I ordered the A1 peppercorn  burger with toasted onion bun and deep fried onion   husband had the Southern charm burger. Firstly, the fries were cold and old so we politely asked for fresh fries.They brought a hot steaming frie basket out almost immedaitely (Awsome wait service). Fries were still old tasting,potato was not normal steak frie fluff in middle but sort of chewy..not edible. We didn't say a word-figured it be the same or worse The buns were cold, my fried onion crisps were cold and old. I have to say the tomatoes were fresh and the only other reason besides wait staff I'm even giving a 2 star for is because ,even though luke warm; the hamburger patties had very good flavor. Would I recommend anyone to eat here??? NO. Not unless nowhere else was open.. also my husband who likes a bourbon coke hi-ball said the bartender was  inconsistant.

We've been coming here for some time, usually it's our designated casual dining spot for family. I'm not sure what has happened to the restaurant. The burgers are ok, not as great as they use to be. It seems though their portions of bottomless fries have shrunk drastically, and yes are usually served semi warm, not hot. We asked for a basket of fries while we waited for our meal, it never came. Our meals came, we were not given silverware or napkins. After several minutes we flagged down a server to ask for napkins. One of our orders was incorrect and had to be sent back, so the rest of our food would be cold when the corrected order made its way back. We asked for another basket of fries, since the 1st request never came and the fries we had were gone. However when our drinks go empty and the 2ND requested basket of fries doesn't come, eyebrows go up. Our server was polite and she was doing the best she could (I hope) but this time around it was a disappointing experience. To top it off it was my birthday =/.   Correction: our 2nd request of basket fries DID come as we were swiping our check card on the table tablet =/

We have been coming to this Red Robin for years. Never have we had bad service or a bad meal. It's a fun restaurant with a nice big bar area, plenty of TV's and great decor. Located right off the freeway with plenty of parking. There is outdoor seating if the weather is good and you want some fresh air. The mozzarella sticks are super good and the different burgers are fantastic. I especially like the blta croissant sandwich. All burgers and sandwiches come with nice big endless steak fries and many different sauces. Great beers and drinks like the delicious and strong "sand in my shorts". The kids love the milkshakes as well. One of our true go to restaurants.

We get there ask the host if they're busy, she said "No, it's actually pretty slow." Our waiter Rodger was incredibly friendly and tentative and all together cool. Kitchen however took forever with our food and they ended up messing up our order anyway. Managers did little to nothing to fix our orders, send our food back and took forever to even get to us. Manager and kitchen staff 0/5 stars. Rodger the waiter 5/5. Thank you.

I had an amazing time at red Robin thanks to management, manager in training Jared, took our order kept up with our bottom less fries drinks as well as keeping my son happy with his crayons and coloring paper then when we paid the manager came over I forgot her name but she was very nice as well the food was quick and yummy thank you so much red Robin for being yummy Everytime we go there

Took the family to Red Robin for dinner 5 adults and 3 children. Food was great. Service was awesone. Only.one hiccup and that was waitress forgot to put the tske out order for grandma. Other then that everyone had a great time.

I just want to say how impressed I am with the customer service and the compassion of the employees at this red robin....my boyfriend and I sat down to have lunch....we had ordered when we received a phone call that resulted in a family emergency....I asked our waitress to please package our order to go as we had to leave as soon as possible.....the waitress (I think her name is Theresa) came back a minute later and told us the manager pushed our ticket to the front of the line and our food would be out shortly....I was also brought my tab quickly and as soon as I signed the tab the manager brought our food out bagged up with extra fries and sauce for us to go!! This meant so much to us and we were able to get to our family quickly! Thank you Red Robin and to your wonderful employees....I will also be contacting corporate to tell them about this experience! Keep up the good work!!!

This place was good but waitress Julia have very poor customer service she need to take classes asap gonna lose customers that way. We were there on 2/1/2017 to celebrate granddaughter birthday and it was a blast from the moment we walked in until we left..the Manager ..I think his name was Joey and we were there for lunch, he was amazing and visited our table many times. He even gave the bday celebrant a free sundae..wow..and Amy, our server was equally amazing..so very happy..the food came fast and delicious too...everything so perfect...

So way improved.  I've been coming here when I'm in town for business for about 3 years.  Service has significantly improved.   The bartender (blonde lady, very nice) is excellent.  I LOVE the new menu with the healthier options and unlimited salad.
Saw a cockroach and we were sitting right next to a booth(which is right next to the kitchen.) we just left. No thanks.

Where do I start...  * Told wait would be 15 min for party of 5... how about 35 minutes. 1. ordered food n sides that never came 2. My wife and I received our food 15 min before 2 of 3 kids 3. Davina provided excellent service. Food was God fries are always a hit. Strawberry lemonade hit the spot.

Recently went back to RR for dinner with my little grandkids. Shocked to find that RR has implemented a new money maker. It's the little video device they casually drop at your table without telling you what it is, what it does and that it costs you $1.99. Kids can activate it without any restriction or parental approval. This little device that customers pay $1.99 clearly benefits RR. I think it is unconscionable that Red Robin charges its customers a $1.99 for the device. Gives the kids some free entertainment.  Just like crayons and paper. Food and service was good.

We enjoy the Turlock Red Robin best of all. Food is always Fresh & cooked perfectly. Love the Avacado Salad. Staff is so nice, always makes you feel welcome. Manager MaryAnn is so friendly, and very helpful when I needed to track down one if the wait staff. Everyone from Israel, Samantha, Tiana and all the staff are just so Nice!
Worst customer service ever!!!!! The waitress Melissa was very Rude. Couldn't get the order right for four ppl. She was rushing and wasn't interested in listening to customers.

My fiancé and I went in for dinner with some friends and had thee WORST experience! Our server was excellent and the food was decent, but I refuse to give them my business again because of the horrible management! I called ahead to make reservations for a group plenty of time ahead only to have them "never receive" my reservation. Came on Mother's Day. Ordered the Avo-Cobb-O. You would think being that the name says Avo in it. You would get more then a few pieces of avocado on it.

Usually get great customer service at Red Robin, not this time.  Told the General Manager that I did not receive the blue cheese crumbles on my burger.  She proceeds to take my plate from me and sticks her fake pink nail in my lettuce while she takes my knife and searched through my burger.  Like I am lying or didn't already search for my cheese! REALLY? Completely disgusted I proceed to tell her I now will not eat my burger. Poor waitress was embarrassed and appauled by her managers disrespectful actions.  Just Gross!

Waitress informed us wrong dinner info and we where not satisfied for incorrect information. Brought to Fransis the managers attention and he didn't take care of us ! Told him I still wasn't happy and he didn't care ! Now I am going to contact corporate and his boss for this lack of care and understanding !

My family had a rather rude experience this afternoon. Our server was never around for one, and when she was, she never brought new drinks or anything. And she kept correcting me when I ordered a strawberry lemonade... or I'm sorry the FRECKLED lemonade as they call it. I also had my plate randomly grabbed from in front me while I was still eating. I'm surprised because my husband and I ate here a few months ago and had no problems. But we will definitely not be returning unfortunately. It sucks because I was happy to live near a Red Robin since the closest one to my old house is about 30 mins away.

My BFF and I went here for lunch. We wanted a couple of drinks and some good food. We ended up getting a really crappy experience.  She ordered a Screaming Red Zombie and I ordered a Blue Moon. The waitress came back shortly to tell us they didn't have the ingredients for the Screaming Red Zombie. My friend ordered another drink instead. A few minutes later when the waitress brought me my Blue Moon, she said they were out of oranges so she didn't include one with my drink. She offered me a lemon instead but I was fine with just the beer.  I ended up having the Pub Mac 'N' Cheese, and my friend ordered a simple cheeseburger. Halfway through my meal, I found a hair in my mac 'n' cheese! It was at the bottom stuck to the bowl. I knew for sure it wasn't mine because I've got really light hair and this one was very dark.  I told the waitress and sent the food back. What really bothered me was that she didn't even seem surprised! She just said, "Oh, sorry about that" in a very bored and monotonous tone. Like this was just part of a routine. She took my plate and left. The manager ended up coming to our table and offered me fresh food. I declined because I had lost my appetite and wasn't really interested in eating anymore. He said he wouldn't charge me for my mac 'n' cheese which was nice. After that, all interactions with staff had ceased. No one came back to check and see if we wanted another drink or anything. We paid for our food (minus my mac 'n' cheese) and left.  My friend ended up with a really upset stomach about an hour later and spent the rest of the afternoon in the bathroom! I don't know what was going on at Red Robin, but I won't be back to this one. I've never been disappointed with a visit to RR, but this experience was pretty bad!!

This was by far one of the worst experiences at this restaurant. Our waitress suze took our drink order. It took 20 minutes just for my daughter's to get their drinks. On top of that, my daughter ordered a grill cheese sandwich. The waitress had the nerve to bring out a burnt grilled cheese!! How damn hard is it to make a grilled cheese? I asked for my burger to be cooked to medium temperature and it comes out more than well done. I am  dissatisfied with this place. Turlock red robin has gone down hill. I'll never come back here again.

By far the worst experience we had and we been coming to this restaurant since it open. First we wanted to seat in the bar area but there was only one bartender helping or assigned to that area, there was at least 10 open seats but since the patio had a party of 10 they said the service was going to be slow. So we waited to be seated at the dinning area. I order a lettuce wrap with a gluten free bun and there was no lettuce in my burger. We order extra fries and it took a very long time to get them (15 min), but the couple that got to the restaurant after us got the fries right away. We asked to talk to the manager and he came to apologize for the experience and that he was sorry we where having a bad day, we never mentioned we were having a bad day, it had nothing to do with our day. It was the bad service and the long wait time that did it for us. He even said that some days are better than other and that the customer service sometimes is not as good as other days, what kind of business is he running. I never in my times as a customer service clerk said such thing to a customer. RED ROBIN you need a new manager. By the way our waitress was so gracious and nice about the whole ordeal. We had nothing to say about her, she did a great job. We really don't like complaining about things it like I said this was by far the worst.

We stopped after looking at trailers it was convenient fast and the server was knowledgeable. We got there for a late lunch/early dinner right ahead of the crowd I say that because we just walked in and got seated immediately when we were leaving I heard the server say there is a 45 minute wait with people waiting in the lobby.  One member of the party got the bottomless root beer which was great.  I got the avo-Cobb salad.  It was good but I have to say it hardly had any avocados .   It did the trick tthough there seem to be a lot of selections in the area. I would be up for trying something else next time i'm in the neighborhood.
The Tavern Mac N Cheese is really good. My problem is the Stella I had was more expensive than the burger and fries!
Not the best in the world but hey its a franchise. This place is nice for a quick casual meal that wont break the bank. Burgers are usually good and french fries always hit the spot.

Great Service and Food as Always! I was eating with a friend who was from out of state and never been before. He agreed the food and service was great! When it came to pay... He saw me pull the table display unit towards me and he asked what it was... I told him this is how you pay. He was kinda shocked... Really? he said. So I showed him how it works and he said that was pretty neat, but I'd never known that since I'd never been here before. So I was thinking about it... Yeah maybe the server should ask the guest, If they are familiar with the interactive display when they are being seated. Might help with confusion for out of state people or people who have never been to Red Robin.
Friendly staff good food fast service ! Love the bone in chicken wings with blue cheese crumbles that come with chips.
Took my girlfriend for the first time to Red Robin she loved it and the service was great
I ordered a hamburger which was really good. All you can eat french fries. The service was great the food was great

I had a delicious Burger I enjoyed it it was a bit confusing because you have so many burgers to choose from the service was great she explained everything to me in detail I told her what I like what I didn't like and she came back with the perfect burger she was such a good waitress so of course I left her extra tip.

Would of loved to give them 3 to 4 stars but me and my family went there to celebrate one of my girls going off to college.  We ordered our food and the cooks did not make her burger they way she ordered it.  By the time the her burger was fixed we were all done eating our burgers and sandwiches so she basically had to eat by herself.  I didn't expect the manager to give us our whole meal free but he could've said here's a desert for her on the house.  If I wouldn't of made a comment I don't even think he would of apologized.  Otherwise our food was good and our waitress was nice.

Placed an online order tonight about an hour before they closed. Asked for extra fries and crispy. The fries I got were all burnt and gross tasting. I moved my burger and found literally a puddle of grease under it. Half of the bottom bun has soaked it up, so that was a waste and half of the small amount of fries in the container were soaked as well. Ordered donut rings, also overcooked. I stopped coming into the restaurant because the customer service had gone down hill so bad. My last few experiences were horrible. The online ordering seems to be going down as well. I always arrive at the time my order is estimated to be ready and still end up waiting 10-15 minutes. Super disappointing. They used to be one of my favorites.

I asked for well done bacon and when it arrived undercooked it I asked them to remove the bacon from the bill and is eat it without it.  the asst. the came to my table to publically shame me for it twice and the manager made fun of me to the other customers after we left.  humiliating experience that ruined a 40 year family tradition of going to red robin.  don't think I'll be able to step foot in there again after the public abuse.  if I'd known they precook all their bacon I would have had it plain and wouldn't still be upset about being treated like garbage.  the waitress got a lot of things wrong but that's no big deal, the assistant manager and manager must just have fun making people feel bad for $2 worth of bacon.

Was hugely disappointed that they either don't celebrate birthdays or not impressed with them. When our party arrived I told both the hostess at the entrance and the waitress that we had a birthday. Both got a glazed over look in their eyes which I took to mean that I had slipped into speaking Chinese. At the end of the meal it was obvious they didn't know how to say "we don't do anything for birthdays - sorry". Lesson learned. I won't take another friend to RR for a birthday. Gratuity - 15% rather than my usual 20-30% (or more for birthday recognition).
Loved their hamburger. Veterans day was on them. Took my daughter and she loved it also. Thank you Red Robin. Have always enjoyed your food. Marvin

This was our second stop tonight our first stop we didn't get any service and we decided to come to Red Robin where we know the food is always good but tonight we had a great waiter he made sure we had everything we needed and more my boyfriend really likes the buzz mac n cheese tavern double which they no longer offer and he went into the kitchen and asked for them to make it for him thank you Chris for your excellent service and taking care of us tonight

Stopped by this Red Robin on a trip back from Yosemite. Their online app is still very buggy so I called in the togo order. It was a relatively easy process and the person who answered the phone was friendly and repeated my order for accuracy. I was told it'd be about 20 minutes. I arrived there about 30 minutes later only to wait an additional 20 minutes for my food. The order was also missing two items and I was overcharged for an extra drink. That said, there was nothing I could do but wait patiently. It was a busy evening and not the fault of the person working at the ToGo counter.  The food tasted great. Love the garlic fries and am still so glad they brought back the real garlic fries as opposed to those "herb fries" they tried to market a few years ago.

This is the second Red Robin where I've had the same experience, so it is time to write about it. I work late on Weekends and Red Robin restaurants are open until midnight, so I have time for my late dinner after 10pm. Well, this location and the one in Lincoln, CA. acted the very same way. I was treated as though I did something wrong by ordering food within an hour of closing. I have no issue with a restaurant having hours the kitchen is open, but if your staff doesn't want to serve food after a certain hour, close the kitchen, don't be rude or dismissive and serve cold food. I left a $2 tip on a $19 bill and you'd think I just ran over the server's dog with my car, based on the reaction on his face. I like Red Robin's food,  but staff at two different locations have now taught me from their actions that I am bad for ordering food when the kitchen is still open
The service at this place is terrible. Every time we come here there are plenty of tables open and yet they make customers wait. Last time I come here.

What a terrible place to eat. I went to Red Robin for the first time several years ago in AZ. I ordered a burger. It was dry and overcooked. Yuck! I said I would never go back. I am a veteran, and heard Red Robin was giving Veterans a free "plain burger" on veterans day. I figured I would take my family there(different state different restaurant)and get my free burger. We got to the hostess desk at 610pm. We put our name on the list and was told it would be "at least an hour". We went across the street to run an errand and was back in about 35 minutes. We were told that our name was called and we went to the bottom of the list. She was rude. I said to her I should be able to leave and come back if I'm told it would be over an hour. We ended up waiting almost 2 hours for a seat. It was terrible service. The food was mediocre at best. I definitely wont be back again. What a waste of time. They should get a phone number or something in case a table becomes available a half an hour earlier than what they are telling people. I actually asked the girl when we gave our name if they would call our name on the speaker outside or whatever and she said, No we will just come outside and look for you." That's ridiculous. The Place was a madhouse. So, to add insult to injury...When we got to Red Robin, there were 4 cop cars. I asked what happened and was told that a customer attacked the server, and a fight ensued. I should have taken the hint that the service was bad. I don't think a fight was warranted, but it was bad.

Arrived here 6:30pm Saturday night and it was a measely 5minute wait. They work fast here. Service is par excellence. The hostess was very welcoming. The burgers are definitely gourmet burgers. They serve unlimited sweet potato fries here! Kids pizza is hot and freshly made. Their onion ring tower is monstrous (see my photo) and it makes a great family appetizer.   They have lots of sauces here for your burgers but I personally like their "campfire" sauce. I forget the ingredients (ketchup, barbecue and something else?) but man alive is it delicious.  I easily recommend this restaurant location for family and friends who are looking for a great burger joint with great quality food and great service.

The first time I went, the hostest seemed like a moody teenager. She seemed botherd just by our existence and her eyes looked as if they were rolling around every time someone stepped in. our servers name was Larry. He was AMAZING. This place is actually really good. I always get the chicken wrap and it is always great.  One thing people may not know is that they have unlimited french fries. You just have to ask for them. I always do. The waiters/waitresses have always been friendly in the 10 years+ that I have been visiting. Most of them know me by name. Just a good local place.

Excellent service by Angelina. She was an excellent server and made the experience at Red Robin very enjoyable. Really enjoyed our food. The manager offered us complimentary onion wings while we waited for our food since it took a little longer than normal.

The wait time is ridiculous. Waited for 50 minutes when we were told 25-30 min. At the 45 min mark we were told we were "still waiting on one group to finish..." they were rude, unapologetic and seated multiple groups of the same size that had arrived after us. Super disappointing.

Horrible wait times. If you're hungry don't come here. It took us an hour to be seated and another 30 minutes for the waitress to take our drink order. People that came after us, had eaten and left and we were never helped. Such a waste of time spent here.
